page.title: 09BOLTON SCHOOL
page.content: Bolton School was re_endowed in 1913 as a single foundation by Sir William Hesketh Lever,Bt, later the first Viscount Leverhulme, and to his generosity and foresight it owes the splendid buildings and playing fields. The two divisions of the school, Boys and Girls, derive respectively from the Boys Grammar School, founded some time before 1516, and the Bolton High School for Girls 1877. The school moved to its present site in 1897.A completely new building in red sandstone was completed in 1965 and additions and adaptations continue to keep facilities up to date.As an independent school,following many years as a Direct Grant school,it is a participant in the D.E.S. Assisted Places Scheme.Under this scheme help with fees is available to successful 11+ examination candidates.
